page.title: 17Ten Tors
page.content: The Ten Tors walk is an annual event on Dartmoor. The walk starts from Oakhampton Camp and will traverse ten of the tors of Dartmoor. The walk started in 1960. There are three possible routes walked dependent upon the experience of the walkers. These are 35, 45, or 55 miles. This year 1985 there were 2500 entrants, and 150 disabled entrants. The walkers move in teams, the size of the team being usually 6 to 8. One route this year was Sowerton Tor, Kitty Tor, Lynch Tor, Beardown Tor, South Hessary Tor, Trowlsworthy Tor, Hartor Tor. That was day one, and ended with an overnight camp. The second day took in Combesdown Tor, Sitterford Tor, and Steeperton Tor. The Ten Tors is a considerable challange for young people.
